bibl.title: Cybele on the Red Sea: New Verses from Berenike.
bibl.note: P. Berenike Inv. 84029 (second half? of first cent. A.D.), found in the early Roman trash dump during the 2012 excavation season, preserves two fragmentary columns, possibly from a collection of lyric songs describing music and dance in a rite for Cybele. - Pp. 675-678: Appendix: Eastern Desert Literature. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Rodney Ast & Julia Lougovaya, Cybele on the Red Sea: New Verses from Berenike.

P. Berenike Inv. 84029 (second half? of first cent. A.D.), found in the early Roman trash dump during the 2012 excavation season, preserves two fragmentary columns, possibly from a collection of lyric songs describing music and dance in a rite for Cybele. - Pp. 675-678: Appendix: Eastern Desert Literature. - Avec résumé en anglais.
